website_summaries.verdict: The New Balance 1400v1 obtained various feedback from the hiking community. This boot could have received more 5-star reviews if it weren’t for its lack of traction and somewhat questionable durability. Favorably, this boot managed to acquire commendations attributable to its comfortable in-shoe feel and lightness. Overall, the New Balance 1400v1 may seem to meet the basic needs of day hikers; however, it must be watched out for early signs of fraying. Also, paying a visit to a local retailer to get the best fit can help amplify its good points.
pros: A majority of users experienced superb comfort from the New Balance 1400v1
They mentioned that it was a great shoe for everyday wear
Some wearers said that the boot protected their feet well, especially their toes
The New Balance 1400v1 was comfortable right out of the box
It required little-to-zero break-in period, as stated by most buyers
A few wearers commended this boot’s lightweight construction
Several New Balance 1400v1 owners lauded its overall foot support
Its rugged look received a lot of positive comments
A number of hikers who tried them on during the winter attested that these boots had proper insulation
cons: A large percentage of user complaints were about its non-aggressive treads that led to slippage
A few noticed that it wears and tears faster compared with the other boots they used
This boot runs small, based on a handful of consumer reviews
Quite a lot of customers had their pair shipped and returned because of its narrow and inaccurate width profile
A great portion of them took the next, wider width
The sole came apart after a couple of months, according to a considerable number of disappointed hikers

customer_reviews.title: Way too narrow for a "wide" shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love New Balance and normally wear a size 8.5W but these are soooo narrow there is no way they should be described as "wide". I am so disappointed because they were exactly what I was looking for and other than being grossly tight, they were good quality and really nice looking. I returned them and ordered a different colored pair from a different vendor and the same thing happened...way too tight. Why can't sizing be universal??? Booooo.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie

customer_reviews.title: Climbed Mt Washington
customer_reviews.text: I broke my ankle 8 weeks before I climbed Mt Washington, and I bought these a month before my trip. I waterproof spayed them and wore them on some casual walks until the trip...I couldn't do much while my ankle healed. The 3.4 mile, 3,600 foot ascent, was awesome because these hiking boots were so comfortable. I didn't get any blisters, my ankle was very well supported. It was a very rocky trail that included bouldering. and I felt confident in them during the climb. I've had other boots that I've waterproofed and they still got soaked, but not these. They stay dry in rain, puddles, dew. I plan on doing many hikes in these!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hummel, Author Journals of the Heart Series

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: These boots are brand new sitting in my closet for the past two years. They are way too short even with thin sox. They are 9.5 or 10 wide but unwearable and I never sent them back. If you wear a size 8.5, they might fit. I would take a lot less than new cost to get rid of them. The fit is just too small!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not anti-slip
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of this shoe and the fact that they are waterproof, however they are not antislip or atleast my pair aren't. I was walking through Japan after rain and had to tread carefully because I kept slipping on the smooth, wet walkway. Weird how something is made to get wet but not walk on somethign wet, a lot of times when I hike I'll have to go over wet or slippery rocks.
customer_reviews.author: S. White

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Widths!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable right off the bat. Due to bunions and hammer toes I require a wide width boot. Thanks New Balance for offering multiple widths in your women's footwear! I'm very pleased with the performance of the boot. I've worn them in slush, mud, and walked through creek runoff and they are absolutely waterproof. Short of submerging them completely they will keep your feet dry. As far as hiking in them they feel sturdy but not clunky and I'm pleased with the grip of the sole.
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: True to size, predictable fit.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn new balance shoes/boots for decades. Always true to size. My only complaint is that they arrived in a 'generic' box, so there are absolutely no care instructions for the boots. Just the boots. I imagine that they are a pair that had been previously tried/returned. Not really acceptable for a pair of $100.00 boots. I can 'wing it', with the knowledge I have about caring for leather footwear.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: great  hiking boots for flat feet!
customer_reviews.text: Based on what I read in reviews I ordered a half size larger and wider than my usual hiking boots. I absolutely love the way they're made and the support they give (I use custom made orthotics) but because I ordered a bit larger than usual re reviews I may have to return them because left foot is really loose. Will see. I am impressed with how great they feel with my orthotics in and they're still light weight! They look like any other hiking boot which is more substantial than a running shoe or other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Maria A

customer_reviews.title: Love this Boot
customer_reviews.text: When I got this boot a couple years ago, it was too short, when ordered in my size. Decided to try again, since I liked it so much. So ordered in a size larger and it is just right. Would like to be able to order the size I wear but at least it fits. Always remember if you need more room in a shoe, use a Shoe Stretcher. It helps a lot. This boot is awesome, its supportive, not slippery at all, a good solid sturdy boot.
customer_reviews.author: OhioAngel

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, Comfortable and Supportive
customer_reviews.text: So happy with these hikers! I spent a good bit of time researching different hiking boots and shoes looking for a pair that would look good, feel good and be good. I decided to give these a try. Bonus - they’re not brown! I always buy New Balance sneakers. I normally wear a 7.5 in New Balance shoes. While super comfortable, they do feel a bit snug. I switched to a thinner Alaskan Knit merino wool sock to wear with these boots. I have been wearing them to work and around the neighborhood to break them in before going an actual hike. I hope to update this review after a serious hike that tests their waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: JR Klein

customer_reviews.title: Runs more narrow than typical NB fit
customer_reviews.text: These are great, especially for accommodating my custom orthotics. Be aware that they run a bit more narrow than most NB shoes. I've been professionally measured as a definite 10.5 W (D). I thankfully read the other reviews and considered the comments that these do run narrow; I ordered a 10.5 WW and they are still a bit more snug than they should be. They really do run narrow! Consider this when ordering!!
customer_reviews.author: Angelinamelisse

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I always buy new balance shoes so I knew what size to buy. I broke both my ankles so my doctor suggest that I get better supportive shoes. These are great. The soles are nice. You feel like you have such comfort. We just had ice in my area and when I walked out I almost slipped and I think if I had my old sneakers I would have fallen and broken my ankle again. I think these shoes gave me great balance. I am sold on them.
customer_reviews.author: Hard Rock Girl

customer_reviews.title: Do not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I wear 7.5 2E in New Balance. These are so narrow that I screamed in pain when I tried to put my arthritic foot into the boot. To make things worse, there’s a $10 fee for returning the boots. If you have wide feet, do not buy these boots. If you aren’t 100% sure of the fit, don’t buy them from this vendor. Even if you have worn New Balance shoes for years, beware. The size is so off that the $10 restocking fee seems like a scam to me.
customer_reviews.author: JulieFromCinci

customer_reviews.title: Love New Balance
customer_reviews.text: The New Balance Walking Trail Boot was perfect for me. I ordered same size I always purchase from New Balance, 10B. No break-in time needed, good support, NB quality, comfortable boot! I wasn't aware of light insulation when I ordered. Didn't need that feature, but I still wanted the boots. I am using them for yardwork & they are great. Love the gray color with bright turquois trim! I would say the gray looks like a medium denim. Loved these boots so much that I ordered 2nd pair, same color, for errands & light hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Vice

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy boots
customer_reviews.text: I got these to wear while on my bike in the rain. I need shoes that won't slip off my wet pedals and the tread is deep enough to keep my feet on the pedals. I haven't had to bike in the rain yet so I don't know how waterproof they actually are. They're comfortable and the top of the boots fit under my pant legs (important when trying to stay dry while biking). They look OK, just like any pair of hiking boots. I would have preferred black but these were the only ones in my size.
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and light weight
customer_reviews.text: The boots were just delivered. My first thought on picking up the box was "that can't be my boots, it doesn't weigh enough". Seriously, these are lovely, comfortable and light weight. I normally wear a women's 9 wide. Ordered these in 10 D due to previous reviews indicating that they run small. The fit is perfect for me. There will be enough room for socks, but the interior is soft enough that you could wear without the socks. Would buy again and will update this post after the trip in May (what I bought them for).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is way off, otherwise a nice shoe for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: I love New Balance and wear an 8.5W in all other styles I have tried. However, these are way too tight for a "wide" shoe. Very disappointed in New Balance as I love the features of this style and really wanted them to fit like my other NB shoes fit.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie

customer_reviews.title: Different boot than the earlier model
customer_reviews.text: This boot bears almost no resemblance to the earlier model. I bought this to replace mine that are worn out from hiking. First the boot is smooth leather and the color is very dark brown and looks almost black. It is a stiffer boot, which I dislike, I like the earlier model it was supple. I hope New Balance reverts at least a little towards the earlier model it was better.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Edges of toe box press into toe joints
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe one full size too large, to deal with foot swelling, thick socks, inserts, bunions - all the things. It was almost great - except for the place where the top of the upper and the edge around the side of the toes come together. That area pressed into my toe joints (yes, bunions) and it was clear that these were a no go. The toe box runs a little short as well. Darn.
customer_reviews.author: abd

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for 13 hour day outside
customer_reviews.text: I work 13 hour plus days outside. Not good shoes for that. Originally ordered a 7 1/2 W and it was too snug. Ordered a 8 W and it was still snug but I was tired of my feet hurting from my old worn out boots so I gave it a shot. Of course once I wore them to work I would not be able to return them because of how dirty they got. Pretty waterproof. Not comfortable, wide is not wide enough. They do look fashionable. I've worn them for probably about 50 hours so I would think by now they would be broken in and aren't.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: My feet thank me
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these winter before last, but when I went to replace them I couldn't find them at my local store or Zappos in my size (12). They may not be currently making them in my size. The grey is the only color that comes with thinsulate to be cozy in cold months. I usually need a Narrow width, but because of the laces this style works just fine for me with PowerStep inserts. I was so happy to find a vendor through Amazon. The shipping was completed before the time frame I was given and I'm all set with new tread for the coming winter.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older pair of these shoes in brown that aren't falling apart like this pair! I don't even wear these gray boots as much as I wear my other pair and they look horrible. I even used shoe goo on them and now they are falling apart in other places! They are comfortable and I really like the fit. I hope I just got a defective pair. I will throw them out now that the shoe goo didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great for the barn
customer_reviews.text: I bought theses boots to use around the barn instead of work boots. It is leather and has kept my feet dry when in wet grass, mud and when washing horses. Very comfortable, and broke in in one wearing. I got it for a great price on Amazon. I recommend this boot.
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: So far these boots are great. I haven't worn them much since it is still hot in Indiana but I plan to do a lot of sloshing through the snow and water as the days get colder. They fit great. They work with my inserts. I wish the shoe strings were a bit longer but that is easily fixed. I'm happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Not as Wide as New Balance shoes generally are.
customer_reviews.text: Being a NB customer for years because of my need for extra wide footwear, I am dismayed at how wide these boots are not! I can wear them but, compared to the four other pairs of NB footwear I currently own - these are not even close in width yet they are sold as "wide". I am not complaining about the quality. They are well made, well padded and not uncomfortable - just not roomy like my other NB models. I kept them because I was desperate and they are wearable but just not as wide as I have come to expect from New Balance footwear.
customer_reviews.author: PatmAC

customer_reviews.title: Only for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed. I love my other New Balance shoes, and I thought this would be great for winter (with darker color and high top), but there's a bar across the front of the shoe (right where the lace area starts) that was painful to the top of my feet. I didn't think I had particularly high arches, but apparently they're too high for the design of this shoe. I even tried going up a half-size to see if that helped, but that shoe had the same problem. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna DC

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe; not wild about the vendor.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a B-width boot, and although the shoes were nice, they were too small in the toe box. So we decided to exchange them for a wider pair and got an RMA in a reasonable time. But unlike other Prime purchases that didn't work out, we are being required to pay the return postage. Therefore, I will try to find the same shoe, but from a different vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Lowenthal

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: After buying and returning more pairs than I want to admit, I finally found the perfect hiking boot! Love these. I am wearing them all over Iceland and they are fantastic. I am very picky with athletic shoes and hiking shoes as well. They are great, very comfortable , water resistant. I haven't tried them yet in a lot of water, but so far, so good. They also are very cute! I wear a 7 in my New Balance running shoes, but got these in 6.5 and they are great!
customer_reviews.author: B. Steinecke

customer_reviews.title: Too snug for D width shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear a wide shoe and I have another pair of New Balance shoes that fit comfortably. I ordered these because I sprained my ankle and wanted more support. I almost returned these shoes because they were just too tight. Finally, I took out the footbed and put a Dr. Scholl's foam insole in its place. Finally they fit perfectly and my feet weren't being squeezed. I love them now but know that the footbed takes up a lot of room and makes them narrow for a D width shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Weather

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy Hiker
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to go hiking in the mountains. Very comfortable and no blisters after several miles of hiking. I have weak ankles, and I think the built-in roll bars must have done their job - many missteps and no turned or twisted ankles. I walked for hours in these boots and my feet still felt great. I ordered the boots in my regular size and 1/2 size larger. My regular size fit fine and was very comfortable, but the 1/2 size larger had a little extra toe room and still fit well over the rest of my foot. I kept the 1/2 size larger and returned the other pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jann Mc

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and look nice
customer_reviews.text: Update may 2020 These boots are lasting such a long time! Granted I wore them about once a month until the pandemic, now I wear them every night for a 2 mile hike since march and they are still so comfortable and look great! the hooks are a little annoying to lace each time, but over all they look and feel good on my wide feet. Updated 2018 5th star added, a trip to Disney and we got soaked from a typical Florida thunderstorm, my feet were DRY everyone else's were soaked :( My boots dried overnight everyone else had soggy sneakers. Worth every penny and 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: sarah in austin texas

customer_reviews.title: Really nice boots!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. I have bunions and was worried about finding boots that wouldn't hurt my feet. These are great and I am glad I found them!! Would recommend and I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: debratano

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with New Balance
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my usual New Balance size, and the fit is perfect. I like the style and function of these trail boots. I have foot problems, and New Balance is one of the few brands that I can wear. The only negative is that the laces are too short. I went on a 3-mile walk through the woods, on hilly terrain, yesterday. These boots were very comfortable, and supported my feet and ankles quite well. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Double Wide size fits great
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I love these shoes. The 7.5 Double Wide (2E), fit perfectly, fully support my ankle, are not too heavy or too light. They changed this model slightly from the one they had two years ago. This will by my third New Balance hiking shoe in 7.5 2E, first pair since the model "re-model". Custom inserts fit in these shoes great, although sometimes you need a very thin foam insert to make your custom inserts fit well, but that is a custom insert issues not the shoe issue.
customer_reviews.author: Fruit Tart

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out for me
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had to return these because they hurt my left foot. It's like the boot was defective almost, it was tight in one spot across the top of my foot. It made me sad because the right one was very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MimaB

customer_reviews.title: Love these all terrain New Balance!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of all terrain walking boots with roller bar from New Balance and I just love them!!! Wearing them as I write this. I get them a half size too big so that I can put heavy socks on, but when I don't need those, I can tighten the laces with regular socks and they are still perfect. Comfortable, water proof, heavy duty walking shoes for the light weight hiker.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn A.

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed. Great fit comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was in shock I bought this boot June 2017, it is now September 2018. The leather has already cracked with holes on each side. I need new boots already because the rains are going to start. They did not last long enough, very disappointed. Great fit comfortable, but for the money just didn't last long enough.
customer_reviews.author: equita2000

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Dry!
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. I wore it to keep my feet dry, and I guess warm, while commuting by bus. Well, then we got hit with more snow than this area's seen in over a decade. And ya know what? These boots were PERFECT! I was not only able to walk through mounds of snow and packed-down ice, but even played around, kicking the snow and splashing in a few shallow pools of melted ice. And my feet stayed dry and warm through the whole thing!
customer_reviews.author: Istoriel

customer_reviews.title: Took these hiking in Alaska and they did not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these a few days before heading out to an Alaska adventure. I wore them the whole time and they did very well. My feet did not hurt, and I usually have issues, especially with plantar fascitis. It rained, it was muddy, there were slippery rocks and the boots worked out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Keikkei

customer_reviews.title: Too small and too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I’m wearing a size 10 on the boots, and was very surprised that this boots 11W were very small and narrow for me. My usual size 10M. Overall that seems like a comfortable boots for walking on the cold weather. I ordered a size 12W and I will back to continue this review.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with these boots!
customer_reviews.text: The time I need to put into finding footwear that actually fits is pathetic, so I was thrilled to find these boots that work so well! I discovered that New Balance is a brand that seems to accommodate my foot being wide across the toes. I slip my orthotics in, don a pair of Smartwool hiking socks, and I'm good to go! They offer nice ankle support, which also helps my knees to not hurt. I like the sturdy but flexible feel, good traction, and fun turquoise accents on dark gray. The laces tend to come undone since they are very round, so I just cinch them snugly and they usually stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Around
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair and I love them. I use them for my work boots as on my feet full-time and am flat footed. I am so relieved wearing them as I have no pain, even from a prior issue with Plantar Facitisis. I highly recommend these New Balance Hikers as well as any NB products if you're flat footed and spend a lot of time on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Pullar

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I have ever made!
customer_reviews.text: If I could only own one pair of shoes this would be it. I have very sensitive feet but I can hike in these all day and my feet do not get sore. Best purchase I have every made.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bonnett

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but stiff!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe seemed to be well constructed, but the leather was very stiff and I didn't want to take the time to gradually break them in. I needed a comfortable shoe immediately and felt that a type of suede would be easier on my feet than stiff leather.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome replacement
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the fit and comfort of these shoes. Had to get a replacement for my TOMS suede boots that my dog had chewed on. The color is nice, double hook laces for extra support around the ankles is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Z. A. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Wide width is not wide at all
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this New Balance boot because I buy their wide width walking shoes - my feet are very wide and normal wide width shoes are too narrow. New Balance wide with are perfect. BUT this boot was not wide at all even though I ordered with wide width - I wore them one time and they really hurt my feet. Disappointed. I've not worn them since. Not sure what to do with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive, great support, comfortable, good value. The only issue is that they run a little narrow. The WW width fits more like a C or small W width. I was able to stretch them some, so still works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri S.

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Narrower and shorter than typical New Balance products
customer_reviews.text: Not really happy with the boot or the vendor. Boots took way longer to get here than anticipated and I needed them badly. Second, I ordered a women’s 10EE, when I normally wear a 10C in New Balance, and these were both 1/2 size too short and way too narrow even with very thin socks on. Third there were 2 discoloration marks on the boots making the finish appear lighter. I suspect these are seconds or were previously returned. Back they go!
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best boot yet
customer_reviews.text: They have great gripe on snow and ice. Extra wide is great for room. The only issue I had was the boots don’t breathe. They definitely contain your sweat and make your feet cold.
customer_reviews.author: Nikole

customer_reviews.title: casual yet durable
customer_reviews.text: for a double wide shoe (EE), these are perfect for my bunion-ed feet (8.5 EE size). The color is pretty to me. I've only worn them for about a month and breaking them in did not take too long. They are casual to wear to school but are durable enough for hikes. I will probably take them to my New York trip.
customer_reviews.author: EsoulTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: So comfy you don’t know you’re wearing boots!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear while I’m on my Harley TriGlide. They are SO comfortable I wear them a lot! I am on my feet 8 to 10 hours a day at work and my feet feel great when I clock out. The New Balance run a little wide so I don’t need to get a wide width like I do with Asics. I can’t recommend these boots enough!
customer_reviews.author: Lorri

customer_reviews.title: Best boots by New Balance
customer_reviews.text: These boots are real work horses. They keep my feet dry and comfortable all day long. I have purchased your pairs because I like them so much .
customer_reviews.author: rebeccc

customer_reviews.title: New Balance a winner!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! I ordered a half size up only because my feet are not evenly sized.(a horse stepped on my foot/arch years ago) . Otherwise I believe you can stick to your true size. I can wear thicker socks too! I wore them all day without a problem. No rubbing, chafing or sore feet at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Lillygirl

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size larger because I read a few reviews that advised to do so. I'm sure glad I did. The boot fits perfectly in the larger size with my thick orthotic in place. It is also well made with good quality leather. Happy I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Swedberg

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good looking and lightweight boot.
customer_reviews.text: Just got these hiking boots last week. They look great and yet are very lightweight for a boot. I haven't worn them to hike in yet, but the fit is as perfect and comfortable as all the New Balance sneakers I've owned. I'm a size 12B so it is a challenge to find footwear that both fits well and looks good. These boots do both.
customer_reviews.author: t. debolt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a new balance believer. Been wearing them 30+ year’s. Have tried others over the last couple of years but nothing compares to NB quality, fit & comfort
customer_reviews.author: MayaMom

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for hiking--fit seemed to be on par with ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for hiking--fit seemed to be on par with other NB shoes I own. I debated getting the narrow width but decided to order medium with so I can wear thicker socks if need be without worrying about squishing my feet--so far happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: DDF

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from the start didn’t need to break them in ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable from the start didn’t need to break them in - wide width fit as expected have had other New Balance in past with good luck with fit (it’s hard to find wide shoes and boots). These are waterproof have tested them! Agree with other reviewers laces could be a tad longer but I’m able to double tie laces easily and they don’t come undone. I have used for walks in the woods and on the street and to work on snow days.
customer_reviews.author: Megan A. Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was hoping for and a great fit!
customer_reviews.text: These worked out very well. Very comfortable - strenuous hiking over rough, rocky terrain a few days in a row and they worked out great! If you always need extra arch support then plan on adding a New Balance insole insert - the support is good as is, but I also used my NB non-custom inserts to provide a bit more support in the arch. I have high arches and wore them for many hours a few days in a row. Very happy I got these!
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Runs narrow
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and a pair of NB sneakers in the same size, these feel like they’re at least a half size smaller due to being narrower. Can’t order up as they’ll be too long. Really bummed, I liked them very much.
customer_reviews.author: MrsG

customer_reviews.title: Great for the barn!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something that was sort of water proof and My diabetic feet would like to wear out to the barn and help with therapeutic horse riding lessons These have done both along with keeping my feet warm! Very stable
customer_reviews.author: Corky Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for those with bunions
customer_reviews.text: Attractive boot, but wide width still not wide enough, sadly
customer_reviews.author: MCKD

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box and on my feet for a five hour hike. My feet were fine by the end. Rocks, ravines and streams, no problem. The wide toe box makes all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: greenlady62

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this very design three times. I have a newspaper route and walk my 10,000 by 6am every day. I need good shoes that are waterproof and keep my feet warm and dry. In Minnesota winters, that is a tall order. They deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Shoe and look nice too
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have worn them about 4 times so far. They fit well, are comfortable and look great with jeans. Only thing I have to get used to is how high they fit above the ankle. They are exactly what I was looking for. I hope to have them broke in by this summer when I go to Alaska, where I will be doing a lot of walking in the wilderness.
customer_reviews.author: wanda

customer_reviews.title: Great support for ankles
customer_reviews.text: If you have bad ankles, these are great for you. I have been looking for high tops for years and finally got them, these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: great shoe for a great price
customer_reviews.text: great shoe for a great price...usually buy Merrells but saw these on Amazon and thought I would try. Very glad to have taken the chance. Just hiked about 4 miles in slushy sloppy snow and mud and returned with completely dry and comfortable feet. Break in period minimal!
customer_reviews.author: gotta love amazon

customer_reviews.title: Ran small for me, but love them
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the first pair in a 10.5 and they were too small. Returned for a size 11 and I absolutely love them! Fit great, looks great and has some flex but sturdy. Been wearing them all day in the house and cannot wait to take them outside!
customer_reviews.author: D. maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for stability in cold weather.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my trip to Iceland in February. My feet stayed dry and not cold at all- even though the wind was 50 mph at times, and the temperature was in the teens. I wear a 7 W, with room for my Orthotics. Good support and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Kollman

customer_reviews.title: If they only went with my little black dress they would be perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with my boots! My orthotics fit inside perfectly. I can wear them for 18 hours straight and my feet are still happy. I have a super high instep, a narrow heel , and as I said I can wear them day and night comfortabley... They keep my feet warm and dry. My only frustrations are the shoe laces won't stay tied even when double knotted and they don't go well with my little black cocktail party dress😊
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A Hyfield

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: I have large feet (12wide) and these hiking boots not only fit perfectly they were comfortable from the minute I put them on! Just wore them for a 5 mile hike yesterday with no issues! May buy another pair in the other color when my size becomes available again
customer_reviews.author: Tara S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my feet
customer_reviews.text: These boots are perfect for me from right out of the box. No break in needed. Everybody's feet are different, so right for me won't be right for everybody. I have moderate bunions and arch problems. I didn't need to add my orthotic to these boots and they don't hurt my toes.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Reid

customer_reviews.title: In Love
customer_reviews.text: I wore them right out of the box on a week long camping trip. They are so very comfortable. I'm in Love!
customer_reviews.author: CMartins

customer_reviews.title: I love them!
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews state to buy 1/2 to 1 size larger. I normally wear New Balance walking shoes, and find this not to be the case. 1/2 size larger was absolutely huge, and same size is still a little large. Very comfortable and waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: Toms Mom

customer_reviews.title: Narrow for wides
customer_reviews.text: Wide width was bought and I’m not sure if there was too much padding but the toe box was fine. Just around the toe knuckle the boot was narrower than their other wide width boots. I returned them
customer_reviews.author: Nikole

customer_reviews.title: favorite hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite new balance hiking boots...I walk several miles each day and like the balance of these boots. They have a roomy toe box but still fit snugly in the heel. They are warm, waterproof and true to size.
customer_reviews.author: jewel e

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy withe these shoes since they have already become defective
customer_reviews.text: I have had these shoes for less than two months and one side of the sole just above the "air cushion) has a hole in it. I am not happy withe these shoes since they have already become defective!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Park

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 8, which usually fits me in the New Balance brand. They were too tight, so I exchanged them for the next size up and they fit perfect. They are well made and comfortable, I was able to wear them all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! I wear a wide width 6.5 and these fit as expected. Very comfortable and when you have foot problems the rollbar technology really helps. Also great that they are non slip. I would definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: happy camper

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of this exact boot. I wear it year round and supports my feet and joints well. They look good with almost everything (except a ball gown) which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle S Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: Lots of toe room. Great hiking shoe for me. It is warm, waterproof and fits. I have a narrow foot and a degenerative metatarsal on one foot and now size up to get lots of toe room. I also have a high arch and narrow heel. These boots already have a good arch but with an arch insert these boots keep my foot back in the shoe, arch fully supported and toes with room to wiggle. Perfect for my foot. I can wear them all day with no problems. I verbalize the virtues of this shoe constantly. For me it is perfect and I'm going to buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boots for rain and snow
customer_reviews.text: Perfect boots for rain and snow. The day these boots arrived it was raining cats and dogs outside. I took these on a walk and came back with every part of me soaked - except my feet! have been wearing them for a few months now and they are still keeping my feet dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: I love it and got a second pair recently
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 7.5 NB sneaker but 8W in this shoe. I love it and got a second pair recently. I also use the NB 1200 memory foam inserts so I have not tested the shoes without them. I wear NB so my feet down roll outwards-- I also use lock laces on these and all my shoes
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Don't
customer_reviews.text: I normally fits in b, but I ordered wide width since it's for hiking, feet need rooms. These run very tight. This is before my hiking start lol
customer_reviews.author: ml

customer_reviews.title: Finally, after an 8 year search! I found boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only quality ladies hiking boots I’ve been able to find in a 2E width. These fit me perfectly, and had a very brief break in period. The pair I ordered on amazon are backup for when my first pair gives out, which hopefully won’t be for a while!
customer_reviews.author: KM0713

customer_reviews.title: nice boot
customer_reviews.text: nice boot - wish it was a little wider. New Balance used to make a similar boot in a 4E which was perfect - 2E is a little tight but there don't seem to be any wider options
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: New Balance Made a Great Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. They are very comfortable and cushioned with a roomy toe box, great arch and ankle support, plus they are waterproof. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Put these on out of the box and went for a two mile walk. Fits perfect, very comfortable, perfect support and very stabilizing shoe. Maybe not the coolest looking shoe but they are awesome to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. My second pair. They come in widths and are extremely comfortable. I can wear them 12+ hours straight. With very arthritic feet this is incredible!
customer_reviews.author: D. Golden

customer_reviews.title: New Balance Women's 1400 V1 Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These New Balance hiking shoes are great. My ankle still swells at times since surgery. These shoes help stabilize and support my ankle. They actually assist in reducing swelling. I love the rollbar technology.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Miller

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a double E. they sent a D ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a double E. they sent a D. They rub on my little toe. I think they run very narrow. I have wide feet. Why say double E and not have it.Laces also to short. Would not order again for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki J

customer_reviews.title: Quality workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, excellent structure. Cool color and sporty. Hiking and waterproof go together.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: New Balance has made its boots far narrower than their past models, which I have worn for many years. Also, these were cheaply made, although the price did not reflect the poor quality. The only good thing was the free return.
customer_reviews.author: Plain Jane

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing
customer_reviews.text: Last week, I ordered a 10 (US wmns) and they were a bit short. So I got the 10.5 (US wmns) and they were a bit too long. Ordering by mail may not be the best choice for this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: M Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: I walk the dog twice a day in Oregon where it is wet and muddy. These keep me warm and dry. They are so comfortable that I hate to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Fay Day

customer_reviews.title: Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: After injuring my foot, I was told to wear walking shoes or hiking boots. I wear New Balance walking sneakers so I would try these. Comfortable, and great to wear when its raining in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: margie brynda

customer_reviews.title: OUCH
customer_reviews.text: The eye holes for the laces dug so deep into the top of my.foot. Don't know if that was a result of the toe box or... Loved the boot if I didn't have so much pain.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K.

customer_reviews.title: BEST boot ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best boot ever. This is my second pair of these because I didn’t want to run the risk of them not making them anymore and me not having a spare pair! I wear these all the time in the winter, and do yard work in them the rest of the year. Can wear them ALL day in total comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Oaks

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right away
customer_reviews.text: This is Mrs. reviewing here: Comfortable right away. These boots replace a different New Balance boot style. I have bunions and these boots don't hurt. They have a straight last that doesn't press on my big toe joint.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Reid

customer_reviews.title: A great winter boot
customer_reviews.text: I wore these boots for two hard winter seasons (including in Iceland) and just got another pair (they're starting to flake a bit near the bottom). They keep my feet warm and dry, and are fabulous to use with my orthotics. I highly recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: J. Graham

customer_reviews.title: They are good products.
customer_reviews.text: They are wide.i wear 6.5 winter shoes and 6 flat . I returned a pair 6.5 size of another brand hiking boots before them. Because that run too narrow. Then i bought this one 7 size which are a little too wild even with thick socks. I still like themselves and keep them for less trouble. too big is better than too small . And it was cheap when I bought it .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: New Balance Women's 1400v1 Trail Walking Shoe, Dark Brown, 5 D US
product_meta.description: New Balance is dedicated to helping athletes achieve their goals. It's been their mission for more than a century to focus on research and development. It's why they don't design products to fit an image. They design them to fit. New Balance is driven to make the finest shoes for the same reason athletes lace them up: to achieve the very best.
